Chuck Hinson wrote:
> And if I understand Roy[1] correctly, the only constraint is that
> agents should not INFER properties from the URI.  As long as things
> are explicitly defined (by spec, by the server, or otherwise), agents
> can and do make use of information embedded in the URI.

That's problematic if the place it is explicitly defined is somewhere 
other than the hypermedia the client has received.

That said, I see nothing wrong in making guesswork on the part of a user 
more likely to work as they expect. Guesswork is a way that humans will 
always try to explore something and it's good UI to react to such 
guesses in a way they would expect.

It's a foolish user though that can't tell the difference between a 
guess they tried and "the way things are meant to be".
